channel.title: [PI] Equipped Items In Inventory
channel.description:
I'm currently creating a method that requires the player's items to be unequipped and set in the inventory. I was wondering what the method was that performs this action, and if there is also a boolean that declares whether or not the inventory is full.
I am not asking for a spoon feed, I'm fully capable of utilizing the methods myself if the name of them are simply given to me. Thank you for your time.
UPDATE: RESOLVED

item.title: [PI] Equipped Items In Inventory
item.dc:creator: @WhyPlayLegit WhyPlayLegit
item.description:
@WhyPlayLegit wrote:

I think I might do something along the lines of

c.additem(c.playerequipment[c.playerWeapon]); c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon] = -1;

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Equipped Items In Inventory
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“WhyPlayLegit, post:3, topic:398872”][quote author=tehsandbox link=topic=496010.msg3626272#msg3626272 date=1307847005]
check out your duelarena code :]
[/quote]

Well; The duel arena simply uses restrictions to specific items when enabled. Ex:

if((c.duelRule[16] && targetSlot == 5) || (c.duelRule[16] && is2handed(getItemName(wearID).toLowerCase(), wearID))) { c.sendMessage("Wearing shield has been disabled in this duel!"); return false; }

What I want to do is unequip an item and place it in the player’s inventory[/quote]If it is right, look at chaos special attack

Read full topic
